title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:02 <asyd> has left #xwiki  
00:12 <jvelociter\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:16 <jvelociter> has quit  
00:16 <jvelociter\_> is now known as <jvelociter>  
01:47 <jvelociter> has quit  
01:48 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:43 <abusenius> has quit  
03:43 <DrLou> has quit  
03:57 <jamesxu> has quit  
04:21 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:25 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
05:13 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:02 <Denis> has quit  
07:08 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:56 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
07:59 <jvdrean> has quit  
08:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <sburjan> has quit  
09:33 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <+jvelociter> Hi guys  
09:44 <+jvelociter> I've realized something : when adding a page via "Add" menu, pages are by default created with no parent  
09:44 <+tmortagne> that's weird I'm pretty sure they used to be created with current page as parent  
09:45 <+jvelociter> ah no  
09:45 <+jvelociter> I'm telling crap  
09:45 <+jvelociter> sorry about that  
09:45 <+jvelociter> tmortagne: yes you are right  
09:45 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: ok :)  
09:46 <+jvelociter> tmortagne: I have a customer that has mostly orphan pages, I'm trying to understand why..  
09:47 <+jvelociter> if it weren't a product issue  
09:47 <+tmortagne> is that special   pages ?  
09:47 <+tmortagne> like pages created from a form  
09:47 <+jvelociter> no content page  
09:47 <+jvelociter> there aren't any custom app on the wiki  
09:48 <+tmortagne> then only way I know is by direct URL  
09:48 <+jvelociter> I will ask them  
09:54 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <vmassol> good morning guys  
10:12 <+sburjan> good morning vmassol  
10:18 <vmassol> ok my challenge for today is to succeed in running AllTests from ui tests on my machine without failures  
10:18 <vmassol> sometimes it just hangs indefinitely on trying to close a dialog box  
10:19 <vmassol> right now I just got them all to run and only got 2 errors  
10:19 <vmassol> I'd suggest you try it you might be surprised  
10:19 <vmassol> you = as in everyone and especially the build manager  
10:19 <vmassol> I'm also going to see if upgrading to sel2 RC2 works  
10:32 <vmassol> cjdelisle/sburjan: is the release over? what's left to do?  
10:32 <vmassol> we need to wrap it up now I think  
10:33 <+sburjan> vmassol: I'm done testing  
10:33 <vmassol> ok cool  
10:33 <+sburjan> vmassol: IMO we should have setup a proper CI. with all agents working and stable.  
10:33 <+sburjan> in paralell with the release  
10:33 <+sburjan> or asap after the release  
10:33 <vmassol> we have a proper ci  
10:33 <vmassol> I don't understand  
10:34 <+sburjan> so have you managed to set correctly all agents ? We had a lot of configuration issues on CI  
10:34 <+sburjan> and failing builds, freezing agents, etc  
10:34 <vmassol> I don't understand what you mean  
10:34 <vmassol> we've been doing this ofr about 5 years now  
10:34 <vmassol> it's an ongoing process  
10:34 <vmassol> we work on it everyday  
10:34 <vmassol> but everyday is a different day  
10:35 <+sburjan> i know. but in the last 2 weeks didn't wh ave a lot of troubles with agent 2 especially ?  
10:35 <vmassol> ah you know more than I do then  
10:35 <vmassol> we've been having issues on agent3 because it's a new agent  
10:35 <vmassol> so that took a bit of time to set it up "correctly"  
10:36 <vmassol> anyway we're doig our best  
10:36 <vmassol> AND  
10:36 <vmassol> we need the max  # of people to help  
10:36 <vmassol> for ex there are still tens of functional tests not stabilized  
10:36 <vmassol> btw I spent a lot of time stabilizing some of the tests you wrote sburjan  
10:37 <vmassol> the strategy IMO should be that when someone writes a test he should run it 500 times in a row on his machine  
10:37 <+sburjan> which one ? I know about the HistoryTest, are there any others ?  
10:37 <vmassol> to verify it's not flickering  
10:37 <vmassol> almost all of them AFAIK  
10:37 <vmassol> :)  
10:37 <+sburjan> vmassol: I'll do that when I'll have a decent laptop  
10:37 <vmassol> but it's not your fault especially  
10:38 <vmassol> sburjan: if you can run it once you can run it 500 times  
10:38 <vmassol> otheriwe please don't submit it  
10:38 <+sburjan> ok  
10:38 <vmassol> it's causing more worj  
10:38 <vmassol> work  
10:38 <vmassol> whenever a test is flickering it's 2 days spent  
10:38 <vmassol> to fix it  
10:39 <vmassol> grrrr  
10:39 <vmassol> third run of all tests locally  
10:39 <vmassol> failing a lot  
10:39 <vmassol> using sel2 RC2 now  
10:39 <vmassol> CommentAsGuestTest almost all fail with RC2 for some reason  
10:40 <+sburjan> hmmmm  
10:40 <+sburjan> I put a lot of effort in commentsTest :(  
10:40 <vmassol> I also spent a lot of time on it  
10:41 <vmassol> to fix things  
10:41 <vmassol> :)  
10:41 <+sburjan> :)  
10:41 <vmassol> and I haven't finished  
10:41 <vmassol> btw things like this shouldn't be in the test:  
10:41 <vmassol>         editButton =  
10:41 <vmassol>             getDriver().findElements(  
10:41 <vmassol>                 By.xpath("//div[@id='xwikicomment\_" + commentsTab.getCommentID(COMMENT\_CONTENT)  
10:41 <vmassol>                     + "']//a[@class='edit']"));  
10:41 <+sburjan> maybe I should stop writing tests .. because it seems it's very very easy to introduce flickers  
10:42 <vmassol> it is, it's hard for everyone  
10:42 <vmassol> I'm not pointing fingers sburjan  
10:42 <vmassol> it's hard for everyone  
10:42 <vmassol> including me  
10:42 <vmassol> I made lots of flickering tests too  
10:42 <vmassol> the only difference is that I spend a lot of time fixing flickering tests  
10:42 <vmassol> and I don't get much help  
10:43 <+sburjan> I know  
10:43 <+sburjan> the js part is killing us  
11:08 <vmassol> hmmm I suceeded in killing my XE instance only with running AllTests on RC2  
11:09 <vmassol> 100% cpu not even stopping with ctrl+c  
11:09 <vmassol> not a good start  
11:11 <vmassol> hmm the tests are passing but I get a "Failed: invalid media type" on almost all pages at the bottom of the screen  
11:13 <vmassol> http://oi56.tinypic.com/16atydf.jpg  
11:28 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:30 <vmassol> ok rerun all tests (with sel2 2.0b1) and got http://tinycoke.com/\_6rDReOnVLhwOw/screen\_shot\_2011-06-21\_at\_11.29.57\_am.png  
11:30 <vmassol> 5 failures  
11:31 <vmassol> seems I always get the defaultAnnotationTest oe  
11:31 <vmassol> one  
11:33 <vmassol> same for testWatchThisPageAndWholeSpace I also get it often  
11:33 <vmassol> do you guys also get those failures regularly locally?  
11:34 <vmassol> working on analyzing defaultAnnotationsTest ATM  
12:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: ping skype  
12:08 <+tmortagne> vmassol: indeed it crashed it seems  
12:25 <jvelociter> has quit  
12:26 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
12:27 <+sburjan> hmm.. annotation test never crashed before  
12:29 <vmassol> it's crashing consistently here  
12:29 <vmassol> every time  
12:29 <vmassol> I'm still investigating  
12:30 <vmassol> it's failing when deleting an annotation  
16:47 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <+sburjan> vmassol: XE-930  
16:48 <+sburjan> I have reported it already  
16:48 <@sdumitriu> Yes, it's caused by the base skin change  
16:49 <@sdumitriu> Not caused, triggered  
16:49 <@sdumitriu> The document should use different icons  
16:49 <@sdumitriu> The standard ones from silk  
16:50 <@sdumitriu> But for me the alternative text appears instead of the "broken image" icon  
16:56 <@cjdelisle> can someone get freshmeat and wikimatrix?  
16:56 <@sdumitriu> Doing wm  
16:57 <@cjdelisle> thanks  
16:58 <@sdumitriu> We should remove the xwiki 1.0 syntax from the wikimatrix samples  
16:58 <@sdumitriu> Doing fresmeat now  
16:58 <@sdumitriu> Did you write the announcement already, for ow2?  
16:58 <@sdumitriu> (release notes)  
17:00 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: any idea if there was another cimmit since the XEM issue I found and you re-released on staging ?  
17:00 <+sburjan> \*commit  
17:00 <+sburjan> can I assume that staging build is the same as the release ?  
17:01 <+sburjan> \*that \_that\_ staging build  
17:01 <vmassol> sdumitriu: +1 to remove the xwiki 1.0 examples in wm  
17:03 <@cjdelisle> sburjan: yes, the exact same files were pushed to ow2 as what I released to staging yesterday.  
17:03 <@cjdelisle> I know this because I compared sha1 hashed  
17:03 <+sburjan> okay. thanks :)  
17:04 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: This points to the RC1 release notes https://forge.ow2.org/forum/forum.php?forum\_id=2002  
17:09 <@cjdelisle> thanks for catching that  
17:11 <@cjdelisle> finished wikimatrix?  
17:17 <@sdumitriu> Done FreshMeat  
17:17 <@sdumitriu> Going back to clean wm  
17:19 <@sdumitriu> http://freshmeat.net/projects/xwiki/releases/333361  
17:30 <sburjan> has quit  
17:31 <@sdumitriu> Done wikimatrix: http://www.wikimatrix.org/show/XWiki  
17:47 <@cjdelisle> I'm going to get some lunch be back later  
17:47 <fmancinelli> On wikimatrix we still have an old picture: http://www.wikimatrix.org/screenshots/screen\_22\_1.png  
17:51 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
17:51 <vmassol> hmm why are all enterprise tests in grey: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/ ?  
17:51 <vmassol> (the last 4 runs)  
17:51 <@sdumitriu> Because I stopped them  
17:52 <vmassol> what's wrong?  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> They were executing all on agent1 which still had the low open file limit  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> I restarted the agent process  
17:52 <vmassol> ok so we're hoping it's ok now right?  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> (changing ulimit only works when starting a new environment)  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
17:52 <vmassol> k  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> Waiting for build results  
17:56 <@sdumitriu> The new Lucene is quite nice  
17:56 <@sdumitriu> But it's not that easy to upgrade, they changed a lot of APIs  
17:56 <@sdumitriu> And the way you're supposed to work with it  
18:14 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: You should enable notification mails for the new repositories  
18:15 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: sure, i'm not done with it yet actually, got grabbed by something else  
18:15 <@sdumitriu> I'll add that to the wiki  
18:27 <fmancinelli> has left #xwiki  
18:27 <vmassol> guys we seem to have an important issue on master with annotations  
18:27 <vmassol> can someone try this:  
18:27 <vmassol> go to the sandbox page (or any other page)  
18:28 <vmassol> click on Annotations menu entry  
18:28 <vmassol> try checking the "show annotations" box  
18:28 <vmassol> when I do this I get an error in red at the bottom of the screen: Error: invalid media type  
18:28 <vmassol> and the checkbox isn't checked  
18:29 <jvelociter> has quit  
18:29 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
18:37 <vmassol> could have been caused by http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6632  
18:37 <vmassol> testing 3.1 final now  
18:38 <vmassol> ok works on 3.1  
18:39 <@sdumitriu> Yes, sounds like the restlet upgrade  
18:39 <@sdumitriu> Something for jvelociter  
18:39 <vmassol> ok reproduced on latest snapshot downloaded from maven.Xwiki.org  
18:40 <vmassol> so annotations are broken right now :(  
18:40 <vmassol> jvelociter: help!  
18:40 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: FYI I just moved wiki components to https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-platform-component-wiki  
18:40 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
18:42 <vmassol> jvelociter: should you rollback the upgrade till this is fixed or do you have time to look into the issue?  
18:42 <vmassol> right now it's going to make the func tests fail  
18:42 <vmassol> (I've executed them locally and the anno tests fail)  
18:42 <+jvelociter> tmortagne: ok cool  
18:42 <+jvelociter> (I thought about putting in my repos, but contrib is good too)  
18:44 <sdumitriu> has quit  
18:44 <+jvelociter> vmassol: I can look at it and see if it's easy fix  
18:44 <+jvelociter> if it's not trivial I'll rtollbak  
18:44 <vmassol> jvelociter: ok good, yes please.  
18:44 <lucaa> has quit  
18:45 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:48 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: I can't find any tag for 3.1 in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise, is that normal ?  
18:48 <+tmortagne> wanted to check platform but there is way too much tags for me to be sure I did not missed it  
18:49 <vmassol> jvelociter: I've reopened http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6632  
18:49 <+tmortagne> there is one for 3.1RC1

18:56 <+tmortagne> too late for my eyes
